title: Old-Fashioned Fairy Tales
description: [...] "Wits and work!" cried the indignant godson. "You speak well-truly! A hillman would have made a better godfather. Give me as much gold as will fill three meal-bins, and you may keep the rest of your help for those who want it." Now at this moment by Good Luck stood Dame Fortune. She likes handsome young men, and there was some little jealousy between her and the godfather so she smiled at the quarrel. "You would rather have had me for your gossip?" said she.[...].
author: Juliana Horatia Ewing
